title: windows 7 won't update after new cpu error 80240037
body:
i know this isn't directly related to league... but it is affecting the machine i play league on. And since Microsoft CHOOSE to disable updates for newer cpu.. i am not going to get any help bypassing this from them... soo yeah... i am asking here because i know the tech people HERE are friendly.

so after my computer got fried to had to replace the PSU motherboard and CPU.. so obviously i got newer versions... i upgraded from a 1155 socket to a 1151

and i got a new intel i5 7th gen CPU.

except windows now refuses to do updates and wants me to "upgrade" to windows 10... which i flat out REFUSE to do. i choose not to do the FREE upgrade... there is no way in hell i am now going to PAY to upgrade..

i like windows 7... and i am going to keep using it until they actually release a decent OS.

so... i need a way to bypass thier stupid windows update block.

obviously i can still download updates manually but i was wondering if any one here knew of a "free" program i could install that would act like windows update and find stuff for my system. i know in 2020 when they drop all support for windows 7  i will be forced to downgrade to windows 10... but until then i would like a way to bypass their stupid update block.

you are a lifesaver... escpaicaly after all those freaking "wannacry" and stuff going around... this is a pretty BS move by microsoft

There is a fairly simple solution to this.  Remove the updates listed below, they are the ones that stop windows 7 from receiving updates for 1151 socket cpus (personally i use a i7 7700k and had to do this myself)

KB4015549 and KB4015546

You will have to turn off auto updating or the will just be reinstalled, but at least u will be able to do the Manuel update, just make sure you dont redownload these 2

We don't do support for Windows, so I can't really speak on their behalf as to what you could do to navigate around that crappy situation. Your best bet would be to try and work with Microsoft to see if there's anything that could be done. I know you trust our friendly neighborhood tech guys, and they might even be able to help a little if you hit them up in a ticket, but I can't promise anything since we focus on support for League.
